body:
There's a lot of accounts on here that are very active and as such have a lot of followers. Usually it's like 20-45. Almost all the people I recognize as power users are in this group. However there's also a group of accounts that is mostly newer than those, posts less...and the top ones have about 70-120 followers (as many as the admins)!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not *that* active but that could just be luck)

6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's **no one** in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And *all* the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

body:
Yeah, the names on the *second* list have been prominent for a while. The first one is mostly accounts I've never even heard of, or aren't very active.

And it doesn't make much sense for discord regulars to have more followers *here* if they're less active. It's pretty much 2 separate communities at this point. Plus I think only 2 or 3 of those accounts are even on discord.

Yeah, the names on the second list have been prominent for a while. The first one is mostly accounts I've never even heard of, or aren't very active.

And it doesn't make much sense for discord regulars to have more followers here if they're less active. It's pretty much 2 separate communities at this point. Plus I think only 2 or 3 of those accounts are even on discord.

post.body:
There's a lot of accounts on here that are very active and as such have a lot of followers. Usually it's like 20-45. Almost all the people I recognize as power users are in this group. However there's also a group of accounts that is mostly newer than those, posts less...and the top ones have about 70-120 followers (as many as the admins)!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not *that* active but that could just be luck)

6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's **no one** in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And *all* the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

post.body:
There's a lot of accounts on here that are very active and as such have a lot of followers. Usually it's like 20-45. Almost all the people I recognize as power users are in this group. However there's also a group of accounts that is mostly newer than those, posts less...and the top ones have about 70-120 followers (as many as the admins)!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not *that* active but that could just be luck)

6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's **no one** in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And *all* the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

post.body:
There's a lot of accounts on here that are very active and as such have a lot of followers. Usually it's like 20-45. Almost all the people I recognize as power users are in this group. However there's also a group of accounts that is mostly newer than those, posts less...and the top ones have about 70-120 followers (as many as the admins)!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not *that* active but that could just be luck)

6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's **no one** in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And *all* the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

post.body:
There's a lot of accounts on here that are very active and as such have a lot of followers. Usually it's like 20-45. Almost all the people I recognize as power users are in this group. However there's also a group of accounts that is mostly newer than those, posts less...and the top ones have about 70-120 followers (as many as the admins)!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not *that* active but that could just be luck)

6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's **no one** in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And *all* the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

body: Possibly, but I don't see any signs of these users being in league with one another or have a particular agenda. The only cabals I've noticed on this site are the admins (which is the admins and the users they chose as discord mods and focus group and guildmasters and pretty much everything else, and usually value them higher and give them special privileges) and a coalition formed by users like Not-A-Bot, firexq, Regmadan, Lukginzis, and a few others.

  7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

  8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

  9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's no one in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And all the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?
post.title: How do some accounts get tons of followers for no apparent reason?

body: Because they make more alts than anyone else.  Most of the people in the list are shills.

post.body:
There's a lot of accounts on here that are very active and as such have a lot of followers. Usually it's like 20-45. Almost all the people I recognize as power users are in this group. However there's also a group of accounts that is mostly newer than those, posts less...and the top ones have about 70-120 followers (as many as the admins)!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not *that* active but that could just be luck)

6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's **no one** in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And *all* the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

body: A lot of them come from ruqqus discord and generally being active and people liking your content. For this reason, old timers with public profiles also tend to have high sub counts. That explains the last 2 in the first part and all of the second part. Another factor is recruiting, which a way to gain subs. You've done it too, having recruited 100+ people. Lastly, it could be alts too. Also you also have a **very high** sub count on for site.

body:
> A lot of them come from ruqqus discord and generally being active and people liking your content. For this reason, old timers with public profiles also tend to have high sub counts.

Except that most of the ones on the first list are indeed newer and less active.

> That explains the last 2 in the first part and all of the second part.

Of course, because the second part is the ones that actually make sense. The first part is the ones that don't seem like they should have that many.

> Also you also have a **very high** sub count on for site.

I know, third highest of the ones that actually make sense. But all of us are still nowhere *near* the top ones that seem to just have followers for no reason. Even the lower end of the first part that is barely even active has more or almost as many as we do. One of them only ever made ONE POST!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not *that* active but that could just be luck)

6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's **no one** in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And *all* the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

  9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's no one in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And all the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

post.body:
There's a lot of accounts on here that are very active and as such have a lot of followers. Usually it's like 20-45. Almost all the people I recognize as power users are in this group. However there's also a group of accounts that is mostly newer than those, posts less...and the top ones have about 70-120 followers (as many as the admins)!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not *that* active but that could just be luck)

6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's **no one** in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And *all* the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's **no one** in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And *all* the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?
post.body_html:
There's a lot of accounts on here that are very active and as such have a lot of followers. Usually it's like 20-45. Almost all the people I recognize as power users are in this group. However there's also a group of accounts that is mostly newer than those, posts less...and the top ones have about 70-120 followers (as many as the admins)!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

  1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

  2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

  3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

  4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

  5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

  6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

  1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

  2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

  3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

  4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

  5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not that active but that could just be luck)

  6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

  7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

  8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

  9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's no one in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And all the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

body:
> I don't see how being a discord mod makes you get a ton of extra followers on ruqqus. Not only that but both are hardly active at all on ruqqus, and the discord might as well be a completely different website at this point.

My point was that they're well liked on discord which is why they have a lot of subs. I doubt Sentient or Angst have gotten any new subs since they went inactive either. You aren't active on discord, thats literally the biggest problem. 

> I don't recognize him that much. All the people I know very well save for angst are on the second list.

Thats your problem. 

> I recruited over 100 people. 

Yea and you have a **very high** sub count as well. There are always going to be people who have it better because of timings, influence, alts etc. That doesn't mean what you're doing is bad.

body:
> Hmm. How often do you participate in the comment sections of guilds not owned by you or you are GM of?

Well whenever I see a post I might have something to say on (which is a lot).

> It seems half of my subscribers did so because of comments and or replies I made.

I don't think I've even gotten a single one that way. People just don't like me for some reason. I never get invited to anything made by users here either, even when everyone else I know does.

> Of course regularly posting good content helps too?

I'm well-known for posting good non-political content. But despite this neither my guilds nor my account grow very much at all. Yet yours do at an insane rate. What's wrong with me, is it something I can change or just yet another thing I have to live with?

> You need to advertise yourself more.

?

> found a mean exploit

It was nothing. All you could do was half-herald posts in another guild. Everything else failed to go through. A real exploit is something like the stuff @sfrohne finds all the time, like infinite coins and seeing deleted posts. She finds them just by skimming through the code most times, and always spots them even though they're nearly impossible to catch, and is not even a programmer!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not *that* active but that could just be luck)

6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's **no one** in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And *all* the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

parent.body:
> Hmm. How often do you participate in the comment sections of guilds not owned by you or you are GM of?

Well whenever I see a post I might have something to say on (which is a lot).

> It seems half of my subscribers did so because of comments and or replies I made.

I don't think I've even gotten a single one that way. People just don't like me for some reason. I never get invited to anything made by users here either, even when everyone else I know does.

> Of course regularly posting good content helps too?

I'm well-known for posting good non-political content. But despite this neither my guilds nor my account grow very much at all. Yet yours do at an insane rate. What's wrong with me, is it something I can change or just yet another thing I have to live with?

> You need to advertise yourself more.

?

> found a mean exploit

It was nothing. All you could do was half-herald posts in another guild. Everything else failed to go through. A real exploit is something like the stuff @sfrohne finds all the time, like infinite coins and seeing deleted posts. She finds them just by skimming through the code most times, and always spots them even though they're nearly impossible to catch, and is not even a programmer!

  3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

  4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

  5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

  6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

  1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

  2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

  3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

  4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

  5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not that active but that could just be luck)

  6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

  7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

  8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

  9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's no one in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And all the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?
post.title: How do some accounts get tons of followers for no apparent reason?

body: There was a rash of account creation that the devs put a stop to. It wouldn't surprise me to learn than we had astroturf accounts with circle jerk followers. If we had more data, you could correlate who those followers are also following and answer your first question.

post.body:
There's a lot of accounts on here that are very active and as such have a lot of followers. Usually it's like 20-45. Almost all the people I recognize as power users are in this group. However there's also a group of accounts that is mostly newer than those, posts less...and the top ones have about 70-120 followers (as many as the admins)!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not *that* active but that could just be luck)

6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's **no one** in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And *all* the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

  3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

  4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

  5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

  6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

  1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

  2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

  3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

  4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

  5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not that active but that could just be luck)

  6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

  7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

  8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

  9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's no one in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And all the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

post.body:
There's a lot of accounts on here that are very active and as such have a lot of followers. Usually it's like 20-45. Almost all the people I recognize as power users are in this group. However there's also a group of accounts that is mostly newer than those, posts less...and the top ones have about 70-120 followers (as many as the admins)!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not *that* active but that could just be luck)

6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's **no one** in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And *all* the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?

body:
some of those are bots. For sure. I know for a fact, one of my 4 subs is a bot that downvotes what i post. Because its highly unlikely that 2 seconds after i post anything, anywhere, someone downvotes it 100% of times. 
  
Especially when...sometimes i say agreeable things, that people like.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?
post.body_html:
There's a lot of accounts on here that are very active and as such have a lot of followers. Usually it's like 20-45. Almost all the people I recognize as power users are in this group. However there's also a group of accounts that is mostly newer than those, posts less...and the top ones have about 70-120 followers (as many as the admins)!

This doesn't really make any sense to me. Here's a list for reference. I excluded admins and novelty accounts:

  1. @eagle 110 subscribers, last active one month ago

  2. @carpathianflorist 77 subscribers

  3. @NeonRevolt 73 subscribers, last active 2 months ago

  4. @Inaki 31 subscribers...1 post 5 months ago and zero comments??!!

  5. @AngstKitten 20 subscribers, last posted 1 month ago and only comments a couple times per month

  6. @Sentient 18 subscribers, last active 3 months ago

For comparison, here's a list of ones I think actually make sense. Notice the huge gap in followers between these and the unexplained ones:

  1. @stars_in_blue_major 41 subscribers

  2. @TrumpVoter1 32 subscribers (private profile which may cause a small drop)

  3. @CrystalVulpine 31 subscribers

  4. @LlamaBean 23 subscribers

  5. @Meguminnnn 23 subscribers (seems a tiny bit excessive because he's not that active but that could just be luck)

  6. @AsininePorcupine 20 subscribers

  7. @no_chill 20 subscribers

  8. @VILLAIN 19 subscribers

  9. @Bidpots 17 subscribers

What's also weird is how big the gap is. There's no one in the 45-65 range. It jumps immediately from 41 all the way to 73. And all the ones in the 70-120 range are these unexplained cases.

I really don't see how this works. I've never even heard of many of the ones on the first list, all the power users are on the second one. So I'm not really sure what's going on here. Anyone have any guesses?
post.title: How do some accounts get tons of followers for no apparent reason?
